decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings:

11CW-PL-00 (Site and Block Plan), 11CW-PL-01 (Existing and Proposed Ground Floor), 11CW-PL-02 (Existing and Proposed Ground Floor), 11CW-PL-04 (Existing and Proposed Roof Plan), 11CW-PL-05 (Existing and Proposed Front Elevation), 11CW-PL-06 (Existing and Proposed Rear Elevation), 11CW-PL-07 (Existing and Proposed Left Elevation), 11CW-PL-08 (Existing and Proposed Right Elevation), 11CW-PL-09 (Existing and Proposed Section A-A)

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2016 (as amended) (or any subsequent amendment or new Order), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the buildings.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012) and policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The detached outbuilding hereby approved shall be used only for domestic purposes incidental to the dwelling on this site, and shall not be used for separate habitable accommodation, letting or any commercial use. No cooking or kitchen facilities shall be installed at any time.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
description: Single storey rear extension & associated internal reconfigurations. Conversion of existing garage into play room & garden store.
